document.text:
From: 
To: 
Subject: RE: GM 
Date: Wed, 01 Jul 2020 13:11:29 +0000 
I just looked back at what we did on Epstein, because we obviously dealt with the same issue of him being arrested a day 
or two before the press conference. It looks like we kept it under seal (but gave his lawyers a copy) until Monday 
morning, and did the press conference shortly thereafter. 
That said, I don't feel strongly, particularly if she's arrested late this afternoon, and we plan to do press conference early 
tomorrow morning. 
From: 
Set: Wednesday. lulv 1.7070 9:07 AM 
To: 
Subject: Re: GM 
Even 1 pm is sort of late to do a conference today. What are your thoughts about unsealing if she is arrested during 
business hours while our clerk's office is open, but isn't presented until tomorrow? 
On Jul 1,2020, at 9:03 AM, rote: 
FYI, the presentment cut off in DNH is 1pm, and if we miss it, she'll get held in a local jail until tomorrow morning. 
Consistent with your views this morning, I might propose that we suggest to Audrey and the press office that if we don't 
have her by 1, we plan to put off the press conference until tomorrow morning, since at that point she won't be 
presented until tomorrow in any event. 
EFTA00029858

people.name: On Jul
people.context:
't presented until tomorrow? 
On Jul 1,2020, at 9:03 AM, rote: 
FY
